connector.description: Read from system-in and write to system-out and system-err streams.

camel.source.path.kind.name: camel.source.path.kind
camel.source.path.kind.description: Kind of stream to use such as System.in or System.out. One of: [in] [out] [err] [header] [file]

camel.source.endpoint.encoding.name: camel.source.endpoint.encoding
camel.source.endpoint.encoding.description: You can configure the encoding (is a charset name) to use text-based streams (for example, message body is a String object). If not provided, Camel uses the JVM default Charset.

camel.source.endpoint.fileName.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileName
camel.source.endpoint.fileName.description: When using the stream:file URI format, this option specifies the filename to stream to/from.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.fileWatcher.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileWatcher
camel.source.endpoint.fileWatcher.description: To use JVM file watcher to listen for file change events to support re-loading files that may be overwritten, somewhat like tail --retry

camel.source.endpoint.groupLines.name: camel.source.endpoint.groupLines
camel.source.endpoint.groupLines.description: To group X number of lines in the consumer. For example to group 10 lines and therefore only spit out an Exchange with 10 lines, instead of 1 Exchange per line.

camel.source.endpoint.groupStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.groupStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.groupStrategy.description: Allows to use a custom GroupStrategy to control how to group lines.

camel.source.endpoint.initialPromptDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialPromptDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialPromptDelay.description: Initial delay in milliseconds before showing the message prompt. This delay occurs only once. Can be used during system startup to avoid message prompts being written while other logging is done to the system out.

camel.source.endpoint.promptDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.promptDelay
camel.source.endpoint.promptDelay.description: Optional delay in milliseconds before showing the message prompt.

camel.source.endpoint.promptMessage.name: camel.source.endpoint.promptMessage
camel.source.endpoint.promptMessage.description: Message prompt to use when reading from stream:in; for example, you could set this to Enter a command:

camel.source.endpoint.retry.name: camel.source.endpoint.retry
camel.source.endpoint.retry.description: Will retry opening the stream if it's overwritten, somewhat like tail --retry If reading from files then you should also enable the fileWatcher option, to make it work reliable.

camel.source.endpoint.scanStream.name: camel.source.endpoint.scanStream
camel.source.endpoint.scanStream.description: To be used for continuously reading a stream such as the unix tail command.

camel.source.endpoint.scanStreamDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.scanStreamDelay
camel.source.endpoint.scanStreamDelay.description: Delay in milliseconds between read attempts when using scanStream.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.readTimeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.readTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.readTimeout.description: Sets the read timeout to a specified timeout, in milliseconds. A non-zero value specifies the timeout when reading from Input stream when a connection is established to a resource. If the timeout expires before there is data available for read, a java.net.SocketTimeoutException is raised. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.stream.bridgeErrorHandle.name: camel.component.stream.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.stream.bridgeErrorHandle.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.stream.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.stream.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.stream.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
